subject: Re: [junit] Possible Eclipse issue in CVS
msgSnippet: Elliotte, The CVS project is hardcoded to a particular JVM name that happens to exist on Kent s computer.  Go into the project properties  Java Build Path

Elliotte,

The CVS project is hardcoded to a particular JVM name that happens to 
exist on Kent's computer.  Go into the project properties > Java Build 
Path > Libraries > JRE System Library > Edit..., and do what seems 
right.  Probably this should just be set to the workspace default in 
CVS.  Share and Enjoy,

    David Saff

Elliotte Harold wrote:

> Not sure if this is JUnit's problem or mine. I just replaced my checkout
> of the version 4 branch with the latest code from CVS and I'm getting
> this error in Eclipse (Mac OS X):
>
> Build path entry is missing:
> org.ecli...g.ui.launcher.StandardVMType/Java1502
>
> Does that means anything to anybody?
>
> --
